author: Mike Bird
title: Why the U.S. Bond Milestone Will Ripple Across Global Markets
text:
In globally connected markets, what U.S. consumers and businesses pay for their mortgages and loans can affect financial assets from Beijing to Buenos Aires.
The yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury briefly reached 3% Tuesday for the first time since the beginning of 2014, a long-awaited landmark in the move away from years of ultralow borrowing costs.
Asset...
